intro: Thlaspi microphyllum subsp. creticum, commonly known as the Cretan rock cress, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region, particularly found in rocky and calcareous soils. It is a small annual or biennial species with basal leaves that are narrow and linear. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in spring. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in disturbed or open habitats. Its botanical features make it well adapted to harsh, arid environments.
